item.title: Two Trade Policy Experts (Category II), including one Team Leader
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Formulation of EU-SADC Trade Facilitation Programme

The global objective of the assignment is to provide expert assistance to the SADC Secretariat and the EU Delegation to Botswana and SADC in order to complete the formulation of a Programme on “EU-SADC Trade Facilitation Programme”, taking into account the assistance provided to by other International Cooperation Partners (ICPs). The Programme is foreseen to be funded by the 11th EDF under the Annual Action programme 2018.

Specific objectives:

To finalise Action Fiche for this programme, to be financed from EDF 11 and to be presented to EU Headquarters within the Annual Action Plan (AAP) 2018. In this regard, the Formulation Mission will complete the programme design, in particular regarding the following aspects:

  • Revise the current Action Document and foreseen activities;
  • Advise on the most adequate implementation modality for each component;
  • Identify the most appropriate implementing partners for each of the components, citing reasons for the proposed implementation partners;
  • Advise on the corridors/border posts to be supported and exact actions to be undertaken in these border posts, taking into account available budget and assistance from other ICPs;
  • Finalise the full formulation of the programme in line with EU project Cycle Guidelines, and assist in the production of all formulation documents needed to be included in the Annual Action Programme (AAP) 2018 in line with the latest templates and in consultation with the SADC Secretariat and stakeholders, the EU Delegation and other ICPs;

Two Trade Policy Experts (Category II), including one Team Leader

Qualification and skills

  • A university degree in the field of international trade law, economics, business administration or any other relevant field in relation to the assignment OR in its absence additional work experience of at least 6 years in the field of trade in goods or private sector development;
  • Computer literacy and familiarity with standard office software packages, email and internet use;
  • Good communication and presentation skills;
  • Fluency in written and spoken English
  • Knowledge of Portuguese and/or French will be considered a strong asset and an added advantage; and
  • Proficient report writing skills.

General professional experience

  • Minimum professional experience of at least 6 years in the areas of Trade Policy development or implementation;
  • At least 1 year of experience in research work at local, regional or international level; and
  • Recent experience undertaking consulting assignments related to trade in goods would be an asset.

Specific professional experience

  • Must have prior knowledge on regional or international trade in goods issues, in particular on standardisation quality assurance, accreditation, metrology and conformity assessment and customs/border management;
  • Must have prior analytical work covering economic or trade in goods related matters;
  • Prior work in the EU, SADC regions or other African countries would be an added advantage;
  • Prior experience undertaking work on trade in goods involving the private sector would be an added advantage;
  • Previous experience in drafting Action Documents (identification, formulation and action fiche) under the European Development Fund would be a significant advantage.
